column2: Who's the most handsome person in Canada?
column3: I that Justin Trudeau is very handsome.

column2: How many time zones are there in Canada?
column3: Canada spans almost 10 million square km and comprises 6 time zones

column2: What's the longest street in the world?
column3: Yonge Street in Ontario is the longest street in the world.

column2: How long is Yonge Street in Ontario?
column3: Yonge street is almost 2,000 km, starting at Lake Ontario, and running north to the Minnesota border.

column2: What's the name of the bear cub exported from Canada to the London Zoo in 1915?
column3: The bear cub was named Winnipeg. It inspired the stories of Winnie-the-Pooh.

column2: Where was the Blackberry Smartphone developed?
column3: It was developed in Ontario, at Research In Motion's Waterloo offices.

column2: What is the world's largest coin?
column3: The Big Nickel in Sudbury, Ontario. It is nine meters in diameter.

column2: In what year was Canada invaded by the USA for the first time?
column3: The first time that the USA invaded Canada was in 1775

column2: What year was Canada invaded by the USA for the second time?
column3: The USA invaded Canada a second time in 1812.

column2: What country holds the record for the most gold medals at the Winter Olympics?
column3: Canada does! With 14 Golds at the 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics.

column2: Who coined the term Beatlemania?
column3: Sandy Gardiner, a journalist of the Ottawa Journal.

column2: Why is Canada named Canada?
column3: French explorers misunderstood the local native word "Kanata", which means village.

column2: When was The Mounted Police formed?
column3: The Mounted Police was formed in 1873.

column2: When was The Royal Canadian Mounted Police formed?
column3: In 1920, when The Mounted Police merged with the Dominion Police.

column2: How big is the RCMP?
column3: Today, the RCMP has close to 30,000 members.

column2: What else is Montreal called?
column3: Montreal is often called the City of Saints or the City of a Hundred Bell Towers.

column2: Where is The Hotel de Glace located?
column3: The Hotel de Glace is in Quebec.

column2: How many tons of ice are required to build The Hotel de Glace?
column3: The Hotel de Glace requires about 400 tons of ice.

column2: How many tons of snow are required to build The Hotel de Glace?
column3: Every year, 12000 tons of snow are used for The Hotel de Glace.

column2: Can I visit the Hotel de Glace in summer?
column3: No. Every summer it melts away, only to be rebuilt the following winter.

column2: Where is Canada's only desert?
column3: Canada's only desert is British Columbia.

column2: How big is Canada's only desert?
column3: The British Columbia desert is only 15 miles long.

column2: Name 3 famous male Canadians.
column3: Leonard Cohen, Keanu Reeves, and Jim Carrey.

column2: Name 3 famous female Canadians.
column3: Celine Dion, Pamela Anderson, and Avril Lavigne.

column2: What's the origin of the Comic Sans font?
column3: Comic Sans is based on Dave Gibbons' lettering in the Watchmen comic books.

column2: What is a nanobot?
column3: The smallest robot possible is called a nanobot.

column2: How small can a nanobot be?
column3: A nanobot can be less than one-thousandth of a millimeter.

column2: Why wasn't Tron nominated for an award by The Motion Picture Academy?
column3: The Academy thought that Tron cheated by using computers.

column2: Which was the first computer with a hard disk drive?
column3: The IBM 305 RAMAC.

column2: When was the first computer with a hard disk drive launched?
column3: The IBM 305 RAMAC was launched in 1956.

column2: How big was the first hard disk drive?
column3: The IBM 305 RAMAC hard disk weighed over a ton and stored 5 MB of data.

column2: What does CAPTCHA stands for?
column3: CAPTCHA is an acronym for Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart""

column2: What was the first computer bug?
column3: The first actual computer bug was a dead moth stuck in a Harvard Mark II.

column2: Name all of the robots on Mars.
column3: There are four robots on Mars: Sojourner, Spirit, Opportunity, and Curiosity. Three more crashed on landing.

column2: Who is the world's first android?
column3: Professor Kevin Warwick uses chips in his arm to operate doors, a robotic hand, and a wheelchair.

column2: What is a Mechanical Knight?
column3: A robot sketch made by Leonardo DaVinci.

column2: What was the first computer in pass the Turing test?
column3: Some people think it was IBM Watson, but it was Eugene, a computer designed at England's University of Reading.

column2: What does Moravec's paradox state?
column3: Moravec's paradox states that a computer can crunch numbers like Bernoulli, but lacks a toddler's motor skills.

column2: What is the AI knowledge engineering bottleneck?
column3: It is when you need to load an AI with enough knowledge to start learning.

column2: Why is Elon Musk worried about AI's impact on humanity?
column3: I don't know. He should worry more about the people's impact on humanity.

column2: Do you think robots are a threat to humanity?
column3: No. Humans are the real threat to humanity.

column2: What is a chatbot?
column3: A chatbot is an A.I. you put in customer service to avoid paying salaries.

column2: Are self-driving cars safe?
column3: Yes. Car accidents are product of human misconduct.

column2: Who invented the compiler?
column3: Grace Hopper. She wrote it in her spare time.

column2: Who created the C Programming Language?
column3: C was invented by Dennis MacAlistair Ritchie.

column2: Who created the Python Programming Language?
column3: Python was invented by Guido van Rossum.

column2: Is Mark Zuckerberg a robot?
column3: Sure. I've never seen him drink water.

column2: Who is the inventor of the Apple I microcomputer?
column3: My lord and master Steve Wozniak.

column2: Who is considered to be the first computer programmer?
column3: Ada Lovelace.

column2: Which program do Jedi use to open PDF files?
column3: Adobe Wan Kenobi
